thread.title: Bonds take cue from firmer rand and US Treasuries | Markets
thread.title_full: Bonds take cue from firmer rand and US Treasuries | Markets | BDlive

author: Madeleine van Niekerk
title: Bonds take cue from firmer rand and US Treasuries | Markets
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Unwanted diesel, jet fuel cargoes could sink oil prices Gold rises on dipping dollar, uncertainty over Fed European shares slip as easing expectations fade SOUTH African bonds were stronger late on Monday, taking their cue from an uptick in the rand and firmer US Treasuries as a US interest rate decision looms.
At 3.40pm, the rand was trading at R13.5780 from a close of R13.6437.
The benchmark R186 was bid at 8.335% and offered at 8.325% from a Friday close of 8.380%.
The middle-dated R207 was bid at 7.640% and offered at 7.615% from its previous close of 7.680%.
The Federal open market committee starts its two-day meeting on Tuesday with the Fed expected to stay pat on interest rates, near zero.
US Treasuries strengthened as buyers stepped in following Fridayâ€™s selloff, which was driven by rate cuts in China, Dow Jones Newswires reported.
The 10-year yield was last seen at 2.067%, versus 2.081% on Friday.
